result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael John Schouten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael John Schouten is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael John Schouten was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today June 5, 2014 by 4:30 p.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Payable through Clerk of Court.
Meet with payment clerk.
DNA surcharge.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Schouten

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reason for Change:  Terminated - Regular.     Restitution = $0.00, Court Obs = $0.00 and Supv fees = $0.00. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, GWC PD & E: Probation. eif
DE appeared from Court.  DE to pay $20/mo comm 7-10-14 then $40/mo comm 01-10-15.  DE signed Pplan Agreement. Includes 14CF111, 14TR1387. jaf

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Brian T Smestad   DF:  Michael John Schouten appeared. Includes 14CF111, 14TR1386, 14TR1387 & 14TR1388. ADA Hahn informs Court of agreement:  DE will plead to Amended Ct 1 Misdemeanor Possession of THC and 14TR1387. DE pleads guilty to Amended Ct 1 - Misdemeanor Possession of THC in 14CF111 and guilty to 14TR1387. Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Amended Ct 1 in 14CF111 and guilty to 14TR1387. Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF111 and dismisses 14TR1386 and 14TR1388.  Recommendations. DE makes statement. Crt orders in 14CF111:  Sentence:  W/H, 1 year probation with conditions. Conditions of probation are:

-AODA and recommended follow through.
-Court Costs $443. Payable through payment plan.

Crt orders in 14TR1387: $10.

DE to report to probation today by 4:30 p.m. DE to meet with the payment clerk today.
Filed by Atty Smestad. Per HWC, file. km
filed by ADA Amber Hahn. eif
Pre-trial conference on June 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Gross, ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Brian T Smestad   DF:  Michael John Schouten appeared.  Case called: 11:06 a.m.  S/T - Officer Joe Heath, Glenwood City PD.  Direct by ADA Hahn.  Cross by Atty Smestad.  10CF230 noted by Court.  Court finds probable cause and binds DF over.  Information submitted to Court.   DF understands charges and possible charges.  NG plea.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: HWC, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler,  DF ATTY:  Brian Thomas Smestad,  DF:  Michael John Schouten appeared from jail. Defendant does qualify for PD.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 11:00 am.
